entry.title: Re: New enhancements for To-Dos with SAP Mobile Start 1.8
entry.content:
Hi @ThiloBerndt , 

Iâ€™ve successfully set up SAP Task Center within SAP Mobile Start to access my inbox. In the web view of SAP Start, I can clearly see the To-Do section working as expected.

However, when I register the same site using the SAP Mobile Start app via barcode, the To-Do feature is missing. The Task Center tile appears, but instead of opening natively within the app, it redirects to a browser view.

Could you please advise if thereâ€™s an additional configuration needed to enable the native To-Do tab in the mobile app?

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Re: SailPoint - Provision Security Policy for users in SU01
entry.content:
Hello,

I'm sad to see no reaction ğŸ˜¶

When we started S/4 conversion and move into SAP RISE Cloud, due password policy differences was created Security Policy that is assigned to each new user in each SAP system. As we are using SAP GRC AC 12.0 also for user creation and roles assignment, I want to use this tool to handle SECPOL. We are already using User Defaults for specific Usergroup assignment but SECPOL integration is a bit more tricky in SAP GRC.

Anyway, if anybody has the working solution how to assign SECPOL in more systems by SAP (tool), please share. I will really appreciate!

Olga

entry.title: Show renamed label of 'Too new to rate' on the employee profile
entry.content:
Hi All,

For a client we are using the standard option for 'Too new to rate' in the performance Review.
We have a renamed label both for the Performance and Potential Too new to rate score.
Is there a way to show this renamed label instead of the standard label on the employee profile?

 

So the marked label should be our own 'Not eligible to rate' label. 

Kind Regards,

Anne

entry.title: Re: BAPI_BUPA_CREATE_FROM_DATA Failed, please help me. Th...
entry.content:
Two areas you need to investigate based on my observation.
After calling the BAPI, you must commit the transaction. Without this, the business partner is not saved to the database. Next, you're using 'Z' for partnerlanguage. This should be a valid SAP language key like 'E' (English), 'D' (German), etc.  Please recheck these two.

entry.title: Which accessor interface to use for db operations in CAP Java project?
entry.content:
CDS compiler generates two sets of accessor interfaces- one for schema layer and another for service layer. Which one should be used for accessing and manipulating data? I didn't find any documentation on this topic so asking here.

The reason behind asking this is that both of the implementations have same names and while using it's possible to mixup them. Can they be used interchangeably?

entry.title: How to recover missing documents in datasphere replication flow without having to reinitialize
entry.content:
Hi 

I was wondering if it is possible to recover missing documents when replicating data from SAP ECC to SAP datasphere via SLT without having to do initial load again. I was informed that some accounting documents were missing for certain days.  Upon investigation, I found that the missing documents wasn't transferred due to error message "Transferring delta data failed due to the following error: An exception was raised / System failure." 

We are running the replication flow every minute so it will be hard to see the error if it happens and we want  to avoid doing initial load every time to fix it.

Thanks,

B

entry.title: Support for Base64-Encoded Fingerprints in SFTP Adapter
entry.content:
Introduction: When working with the SFTP Adapter in SAP Process Orchestration, one critical step during the SSH handshake is the validation of the server fingerprint. This fingerprint ensures that the adapter is connecting to the correct server and not an imposter, thereby guaranteeing the authenticity of the communication channel.

Traditionally, server fingerprints were shared in hexadecimal format (e.g., MD5:9c:b9:de:cc:... or SHA1:3f:17:6c:bb:...). However, many modern servers now provide fingerprints in Base64 format (e.g., SHA256:rmwIF2dwgkeh0m/...).

This difference in representation can lead to problems when setting up or running an SFTP channel, especially if the adapter only expects a hex-formatted fingerprint while the server provides Base64.

Problem / Symptom: The fingerprint mismatch often surfaces as a runtime error during message processing. For example, you might notice the following entry in the channel logs:

Exception received: com.jcraft.jsch.JSchException: Fingerprint invalid. Fingerprint is: SHA256:rmwIF2dwgkeh0m/...

At first glance, the fingerprint looks valid as it is prefixed with SHA256:. But the problem is that the adapter expects a hexadecimal value, whereas the server has sent the fingerprint in Base64 encoding. Because of this mismatch, the adapter cannot validate the server during the SSH handshake, and message processing fails.

Solution: To address this issue, the SFTP Adapter has been enhanced to support Base64-encoded server fingerprints (e.g., SHA256:rmwIF2dwgkeh0m/...).

A new advanced mode parameter has been introduced:

useBase64Fingerprint (default: false)

  • Default behavior (false)
    If the parameter is not set or explicitly set to false, the adapter automatically converts Base64-encoded server fingerprints into the expected hexadecimal format before performing validation.
    • Example:
      • Server Fingerprint (Base64): SHA256:rmwIF2dwgkeh0m/...
      • Channel Fingerprint (configured in Hex): ae:6c:08:17:67:70:82:47:...
      • Adapter converts Base64 â†’ Hex internally, then compares.
  • When set to true
    The adapter directly reads the server fingerprint in Base64 format. In this case, the channel must also be configured with the fingerprint in Base64 format.
    • Example:
      • Server Fingerprint (Base64): SHA256:rmwIF2dwgkeh0m/...
      • Channel Fingerprint (Base64): SHA256:rmwIF2dwgkeh0m/...
      • Both are compared as Base64 strings.

This enhancement gives flexibility for both legacy configurations (hex fingerprints) and modern servers (Base64 fingerprints), ensuring compatibility and reducing configuration errors.

For SP/patch level details following SAP Note can be referred: 3652688 - Support for Base64-Encoded Fingerprints in SFTP Adapter

entry.title: Re: Italy pre-configured Tax Codes in SAP S/4HANA Public...
entry.content:
For a non-deductible input tax scenario, the entire tax amount should be posted as a debit to the expense account. There should be no credit to Output VAT GL. The vendor line item should reflect the gross amount (net + tax), with no separate VAT credit.

If that is not happening, review your Tax Code configuration and see that the â€œNon-deductibleâ€ flag is properly set for Tax Code X0. Ensure deductible percentage = 0% and non-deductible = 100%. EU Code 9 is typically used for reverse charge or zero balance acquisition tax. If this is not a reverse charge scenario, consider changing the EU Code to one that reflects non-deductible domestic input tax

entry.title: Re: Massive clean-up of old email addresses in SU01
entry.content: Hello @Selle1, if "resigned user" means offboarded user, someone who left and does not need SAP account anymore, this user should be deactivated - validity limited to the end of employee contract validity, roles removed and user locked in all SAP systems where exists. We also set Usergroup DEACTIVATED to as another marking of "dead access". Most of these SAP accounts have e-mail address filled in User Master Data, but we keep personal data including e-mail in SU01. But if would be required to remove some personal data like e-mail address, I would use GRC Access Request as we usually use for User Master Data changes. Mass changes are possible and logged by this tool. There are also other ways, a bit dirty, but it's a question if would be accepted by auditor/s. Olga

entry.title: Where I get the Practice Questions of SAP C_BOCR_08 Prep?
Re: SAP BTP ABAP Environment â€“ New software delivery option â€œAdd-On Productâ€
entry.content:
In the table â€œOverview about the two delivery options for commercial partnersâ€ it mentions that â€œProduct Offering in SAP Store is Mandatoryâ€.

The pre-requisites for an SAP Partner to keep their PartnerEdge Build status is to have at least one solution listed on the SAP store, correct? This solution is called GTM-ready by SAP. When the solution is listed there, the partner has to comply with SAPâ€™s revenue-sharing and related policies.

As a PartnerEdge Build partner, we already have a solution listed on the SAP Store. 

Question: If we create solutions in the future that are SAP BTP extensions (either â€˜key-user extensibilityâ€™ or â€˜developer extensibilityâ€™) is it mandatory to add those specific solutions to the SAP Store before selling them to a customer/partner? Or is it only mandatory to have at least 1 (any/other) solution on the store, like we already have?

entry.title: Reporting of GHG emissions - Receiving of actual emissions sent by your carrier
entry.content:
Transportation Management (TM) in SAP S/4HANA 2023 introduces enhanced capabilities for calculating, incorporating into planning, and visualizing the carbon footprint of transportation.

However, there is more to it. Sustainability as part of Transportation Management offers a comprehensive overview of these features. In the blog post titled "Maintain Carbon Emission on Vehicle Type" authored by my colleague Michael Haase, we detail the necessary master data setup for accurate calculations.

Additionally, we provide the option to manually maintain received actual emission values for your Transportation Orders, as provided by the carrier. What has been lacking, until now, is the capability to automatically update these actual values using an API.

In this blog post, we aim to equip you with the tools necessary to achieve automated actual emission value updates on the header level, contributing to your sustainability journey.

KBA 3654588 outlines the step-by-step process for accomplishing this.

Following the approach detailed, an inbound message, sent externallyâ€”for instance, by the carrierâ€”will include two new fields: one for the emission value and another for the unit of measure. 

                            
<TransportationEventNotificationMessage>
<MessageHeader>
</MessageHeader>
<TransportationEvent>
<ObjectReference>
<TransportationOrderID>61001369908</TransportationOrderID>
</ObjectReference>
<Event>
<EventTypeCode>REPORT_EMIVAL_DOC</EventTypeCode>
<EventReasonText>CO2 emission Updated.</EventReasonText>
<ExpectedDateTime>XXX</ExpectedDateTime>
<EstimatedDateTime/>
<ActualDateTime>XXX</ActualDateTime>
<n1:EmissionValue xmlns:n1="http://gtt.com/xi/TMS/EventNotif_In">1256</n1:EmissionValue>
<n1:EmissionValueUom xmlns:n1="http://gtt.com/xi/TMS/EventNotif_In">KG</n1:EmissionValueUom>
</Event>
</TransportationEvent>
</TransportationEventNotificationMessage>

Fig. 1 illustrates the enhanced payload.

This will update your Freight Order 61001369908 accordingly. Activating the views for carbon emissions in the Freight Order will display a window that shows the reported carbon emissions.

Fig. 2 illustrates the reported carbon emissions.

Navigating to the Execution Tab displays event information. Specifically, we are interested in the event that pertains to the reported emission values.

Fig. 3 illustrates the received event 'Report Emission Values for Documents' as part of your execution data.

 

That's it for now.

Stay tuned, there is even more to come.

entry.title: Re: How are markup, customs, and freight amountsâ€”posted t...
entry.content:
The origin group is typically used to categorize costs for cost component splits or detailed analysis. But if the system is configured correctly, actual costing will still absorb the values from MIGO postings; even without origin group, because the material ledger captures all inventory-relevant postings.

So to answer your question, Yes, in SAP S/4HANA, markup, customs, and freight posted via purchase conditions at MIGO can be added to actual costing without using the origin group. The key is to ensure that the condition types are inventory-relevant, mapped to cost-relevant account keys, and that the material ledger is active. This setup allows the costs to be absorbed into the materialâ€™s actual cost during goods receipt

entry.title: Duplicated invoice posting issues for ERS job
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support,

We"ve met duplicated invoice posting issues for ERS job.

Background: When we create Purchase order, post goods issue, we use ERS function, schedule supplier invoice job, to create the invoice every day. Normally, once the invoice was posted for the goods receipt document, at the next day, it won"t create the invoice again.

Problem: We have purchase order 4500004906, the goods receipt document 500000263 was reversed by 500000264 on the same day before ERS job run.

When run ERS job, it created a supplier invoice job with amount 0.

The problem is that system created the supplier invoice with amount 0 every day for the same goods receipt document 500000263 and 500000264.

Questions:

Why system can create the supplier invoice many times for the same goods receipt document (with its reversal document)?

Why ERS job can create the supplier invoice job with amount 0? (When use APP "Create supplier invoice, it cannot post the invoice with amount 0).

Temporary solution:

There are many reversal GR documents like above example, we cancelled the job, and rescheduled it, changed the goods receipt posting date from Sep.12, then the problem is solved.

Questions: How can we avoid such duplicated posting issues in future?

Thank you.

Best Regards,

Grace

entry.title: Re: Code Vulnerability Analyzer Checks
entry.content:
Dear Martin,

All CVA checks are listed in SAP Note 1921820. You can identify new checks by the "Release" column.

Regarding SAP Note 3326886 â€“ yes, you are right. It is not possible to provide complete protection using only static security scans; you also need other security measures. The situation is similar to AUTHORITY-CHECK: you may have correct AUTHORITY-CHECK statements in your code, but they will not help if users have inappropriate authorizations, e.g., SAP_ALL.

entry.title: Re: Bridging the gap with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Safekeeper
entry.content:
No. Safekeeper is only available as an upsell for RISE with SAP S/4HANA cloud, private edition / SAP Cloud ERP Private cloud services or RISE with SAP S/4HANA cloud, private edition, tailored option / SAP Cloud ERP Private, tailored option cloud services.

Safekeeper is not available for on-premise solutions.

On-premise customers that want to utilize Safekeeper need to move to RISE with SAP S/4HANA cloud, private edition / SAP Cloud ERP Private or RISE with SAP S/4HANA cloud, private edition, tailored option / SAP Cloud ERP Private, tailored option while their system is still in Mainstream or Extended Maintenance in order to then afterwards be in a position to benefit from Safekeeper.

As an example, a customer on SAP S/4HANA on-premise release 1709 would have to move to RISE before end of 2025 to then benefit from Safekeeper in the time frame Jan 1, 2026 to March 31, 2028.

entry.title: Re: Duplicated invoice posting issues for ERS job
entry.content:
I could see two reasons to your root cause of the issue for the system Creating Duplicate Invoices with Amount 0.

ERS jobs evaluate open GRs for invoicing. If a GR is reversed after posting but before ERS runs, the system still sees the original GR as eligible. The reversal document doesnâ€™t always block the original GR from being picked upâ€”especially if the reversal is on the same day and the ERS job doesnâ€™t check reversal status properly.

When the ERS job picks up both the original GR and its reversal, the net quantity becomes zero. The system still tries to post an invoice, resulting in a zero-amount invoice. The â€œCreate Supplier Invoiceâ€ app has stricter validation and blocks zero-amount invoices, but ERS jobs donâ€™t always enforce that.

To fix this permanently, exclude the reversed GRs from ERS selection. This you can do with your ERS job variant or selection logic filters out reversed GRs, like movement type 102 or 122 should not be considered in your filter.

I do not think there is a standard straightforward solution for this. May be you can try a workaround. Create a table with very limited data which is most guaranteed to exist. Hello @Vanna_nh 

Changing the company code currency (10) is not possible in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, as previously mentioned by @puneetkalra.

Whenever you're working with tolerance limits, LVA thresholds, or similar settings, make sure to always use the company code's currency, which is KHR(in this case).

If policies need to be in USD, you can either convert them into KHR or re-provision the company code with USD as the currency type.

entry.title: Re: Production order Item number of reservation RSPOS cha...
entry.content:
The IDoc (e.g., MBGMCR or MBCREATE) carries the original RSPOS from the reservation. This reflects the component item number as maintained in the production order via RESB.

During goods movement posting, SAP may renumber or reassign RSPOS in the material document due to:

  • Partial goods issues
  • Multiple components with same material
  • Backflush logic
  • Batch splits or serial number handling

The system sometimes reuses or reassigns item numbers to optimize document structure, especially if multiple movements are merged.


Check the following

  • Go to RESB Table and confirm the original reservation item number for the component.
  • Go to MKPF/MSEG and check how the item is posted in the material document.
  • Go to CO03 and see if multiple components share the same material or have batch splits.
  • Some movement types like 261 may trigger internal renumbering.

entry.title: Devtoberfest 2025 - Integration track sessions
entry.content:
We are days away from the first session of this year's Devtoberfest, our annual virtual celebration dedicated to the SAP developer community. Like previous years, there is a lot going on in the integration space, and as part of Devtoberfest 2025 we will have sessions covering the following topics: Architecture, AI, Event-driven Architectures, Tools for integration developers, open source and more.

As you might be aware, every track is assigned a unique day across the four weeks that Devtoberfest takes place and Wednesdays will be all about integration.

Devtoberfest 2025 sessions

You can find all the different tracks/sessions that are part of Devtoberfest here. You can filter all events by selecting the topic (label) you are interested in, e.g. integration ğŸ˜‰.

Let me quickly share all the sessions that we will have as part of the integration track:

1st of October:

  • 09:30 - ğŸ”´Pipeline for Cloud Integration
  • 11:00 - ğŸ”´ Clean Core, Event-Driven: Unlocking SAP Value with Advanced Event Mesh
  • 13:00 - ğŸ”´ SAP Architecture Center: A GitHub-based Approach for Architectural Collaboration around Solution Diagrams
  • 15:00 - ğŸ”´ IT System Landscape Transparency with Open Resource Discovery (ORD)

8th of October:

  • 09:30 - ğŸ”´ Warp-Speed for Event Creation: Overview on the new Event Add-on for ERP

  • 17:00 - ğŸ”´ Unleash Next-Generation Hybrid Integration with Edge Integration Cell

15th of October:

Note: If you click on any of the times of the sessions above, you will download the calendar invite for the session.

So go ahead and RSVP to the different sessions you are interested in. Also, make sure to download the calendar invites so that you don't miss the session and you can get a chance to ask the speaker any questions that you might have about the topic.

Happy learning this Devtoberfest 2025!
